engine_status: V2 CYCLE 4 COMPLETE -- QUANTITATIVE DEEPENING CYCLE. O*NET Polanyi classification + BLS wage/employment data produce first quantified Baumol Cure Priority Matrix: $207B automatable wage bill across 7 key occupations. Stress tests on top 3 opportunities with real competitive data. 3 under-explored sectors assessed (Mental Health AI PROMOTED to Tier 2, Government AI to Tier 3, Real Estate AI DISMISSED). 20 signals scanned. NEW PATTERNS: P-013 Dead Business Revival (Bench $113M + Woebot $123M), P-014 Quantitative Baumol Matrix. KEY ADJUSTMENTS: Accounting -2 (Intuit Accountant Suite + Bench precedent), Manufacturing -1 (integration complexity stress test), Food -1 (margin risk + FSMA 204 traceability).

tier_1.structural_shift: SMB Accounting/Finance -- Full-Service Layer Gap (STRESS TESTED)

business_models.name: AI-First Full-Service SMB Bookkeeping (NOT Tool Layer)
business_models.target: 23M US single-entity small businesses without CPA + 35K orphaned Bench customers
business_models.unit_economics: Inference cost ~$0.05/month per client. Support/compliance ~$10/client/month. Target margin 60-70% at $199/month price point. CAC estimate: $200-500 for unserved SMBs (lower friction than switching).

business_models.name: Fractional AI CFO for Growth SMBs
AI Tax for US-LATAM Cross-Border

tier_1.key_signals: O*NET: Bookkeepers 91% automation risk, Tax Preparers 99%, Accountants 67%. BLS: 1.5M bookkeepers + 1.4M accountants = $139B automatable wage base. BLS outlook: bookkeepers -5% (pre-cascade employment decline). 75% CPAs retiring. 70% SMBs unserved. Tool layer crowded AND NOW THREATENED by embedded AI (Intuit Accountant Suite replacing QBO Accountant, Feb 2026). Service layer emerging (Basis, Docyt). FULL-SERVICE layer EMPTY. Bench Accounting collapsed Dec 2024 ($113M raised, 35K customers) -- market proven, cost structure failure. AI-first at $0.05/month solves Bench's failure mode.
tier_1.cycle_4_updates: STRESS TESTED. #1 kill risk: Intuit Accountant Suite (AI-native platform replacement, $149/mo Accelerate plan) + Bench collapse precedent. RESULT: Intuit serves accountants (B2B2C), NOT SMBs directly. The Christensen disruption path (direct-to-SMB full-service) remains empty. Bench's $113M failure VALIDATES market (35K customers) while proving AI+offshore-human model fails. Pure AI at $0.05/month solves cost structure. Score -2 for competitive threat but thesis strengthened by quantitative data: $139B automatable wage base, BLS bookkeepers -5% employment = pre-cascade confirmed. CA AB 1175 (signed Oct 2025, effective Jan 2027) lowers CPA licensing barrier.
barriers: CPA licensing (moat -- CA AB 1175 easing Jan 2027, still 2-3yr moat)
Intuit Accountant Suite entering service layer (but B2B2C, not direct-to-SMB)
Bench $113M collapse precedent (validates market but shows operational difficulty)
Embedded AI in Xero/Intuit threatening tool layer (validates service/full-service focus)
Trust deficit for financial data (target unserved first)
moats: Data flywheel from serving unserved SMBs
next_steps: Build AI-first full-service bookkeeping for single-entity SMBs
Price at $149-199/month (below Zeni $549 but above DIY)
Acquire/partner 1-2 small CPA practices in CA for licensing (AB 1175 transition)
Target Bench orphaned customers (35K validated buyers)
Target unserved 23M SMBs (no switching friction)
Monitor Intuit Accountant Suite rollout for direct-to-SMB expansion

tier_1.structural_shift: Healthcare Admin AI -- Provider-Side Opportunity (O*NET VALIDATED)

business_models.name: AI Healthcare Admin for Independent Practices (Provider-Side)
Provider-Side Prior Auth AI (Counter to WISeR Payer AI)
business_models.target: Practices in WISeR states needing to navigate AI-powered prior auth

business_models.name: Horizontal AI Business-in-a-Box for Independent Practices

tier_1.key_signals: O*NET: Medical Records 97% automation probability (HIGHEST of all 15 occupations screened). BLS: 185,690 medical records specialists at $47,180/yr = $9B automatable wage base. BUT the real force is the $200B+ admin overhead across ALL healthcare. RNs at 10% automation = strong Baumol PREMIUM (human judgment = premium wage). CMS WISeR vendor selection CLOSED. Congressional repeal bill. AMA: 61% say AI increases denials. Competitors hyper-specialized (HealthSpark PT, Verse SLP). No HORIZONTAL platform. BLS: Medical records employment growing +8.7% DESPITE 97% automation potential = Schumpeterian gap period (window open NOW).
tier_1.cycle_4_updates: Score unchanged. O*NET data VALIDATES thesis quantitatively: Medical Records 97% is the deepest automation potential in any occupation screened. The +8.7% employment growth despite 97% automation potential is textbook Schumpeterian gap period -- demand growing, costs rising, AI ready to cure, but adoption not yet materialized. Window is OPEN. Provider-side thesis unchanged. No new competitive threats identified this cycle.
barriers: Physician opposition to AI in care decisions

medical_records.note: Highest automation rate of any screened occupation

rns.note: Baumol PREMIUM -- human judgment commands premium wages

next_steps: Start with provider-side: help practices fight AI-powered denials
Build horizontal platform (not hyper-specialized by practice type)
Pilot in WISeR states where practices face new prior auth burden
Use HIPAA-compliant platforms (Hathr.ai / OpenAI) to reduce infra cost
NOT YET STRESS TESTED -- priority for cycle 5

tier_1.structural_shift: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition & Modernization (STRESS TESTED)

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: CNC Machine Shop (Specific Target Profile)
business_models.target: Retirement-sale CNC/fabrication shops in CA ($1-3M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA)
business_models.capital_structure: SBA 504 $1.2M (5.85%, 25yr, fees waived) + Bank $1.5M (7%, 10yr) + Equipment financing $400K (8%, 5yr, 80% LTV) + Equity $550K
business_models.unit_economics: Monthly debt service ~$18K. Pre-modernization EBITDA $29K/mo (covers debt from day 1). Post-modernization: $163-195K/yr additional savings from 25-30% COGS reduction. 5-station cobot modernization: $225-550K. ROI 8-14 months on robotics investment.
business_models.production_fit: STRONG -- custom fabrication, precision parts, variable products

business_models.name: Manufacturing AI Integration Service
business_models.target: SME manufacturers needing help deploying AI/robotics

tier_1.key_signals: REAL DATA: 379 CA manufacturing businesses for sale (BizBuySell). Median asking $600K. CNC shops: $1.25M-$3M asking, $1-2M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA. SBA 504 actual rates 5.67-5.91% (Feb 2026), fees waived through Sept 2026 for manufacturers. O*NET: Machinists 79% automation risk BUT manual dexterity resists = PARTIAL automation thesis confirmed (automate programming/scheduling, enhance manual precision). COBOT ROI VALIDATED: 35% adoption surge 2024, 8-14 month payback, single cobot saves $65-85K/yr, cobots 30% of new installations.
tier_1.cycle_4_updates: STRESS TESTED. Score -1 (from 84). #1 kill risk: Operational complexity (NOT cobot ROI). RESULT: Cobot ROI is proven (8-14 months, $65-85K/yr savings). The risk is execution -- 70% M&A synergy failure rate means operational capability IS the moat. Skills gap (not cost) is the bottleneck for manufacturing AI deployment. O*NET confirms machinists are PARTIALLY automatable: 79% overall automation risk, but manual dexterity and spatial reasoning resist pure automation. This supports the acquire-and-ENHANCE model (not acquire-and-automate). Manufacturing integration timeline remains 12-18 months realistic.
barriers: 70% M&A synergy failure rate (operational capability is key)
Skills gap for manufacturing AI deployment (constraint shifted from cost to talent)
moats: Skills gap = barrier to competitors too

machinists.note: Partial automation -- manual dexterity resists. Enhance model, not replace.

next_steps: Screen specific BizBuySell CNC/fabrication listings in CA with $1-3M revenue
Establish CDC relationship for SBA 504 (Statewide CDC for fast processing)
Identify cobot integration partners (UR/FANUC distributors in CA)
Build due diligence framework for manufacturing acquisitions (specifically addressing 70% M&A failure factors)
Timeline: begin screening now, target acquisition by Q3 2026 (before SBA fee waiver expires Sept 30)

tier_1.structural_shift: Specialty Food/Beverage Production AI + Robotics (STRESS TESTED)

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: Specialty Food Producer (Wholesale Bakery Profile)
business_models.target: Retiring CA food producers ($1-2M revenue, SPECIALTY/BRANDED only)
business_models.unit_economics: Wholesale bakery: $1.7M revenue, $500K profit, 14 employees. Acquire at $1-1.5M. Add 2-3 cobots ($100-180K) + AI scheduling/QC ($50-100K). Automate 4-5 positions ($160-200K/yr savings). Increase throughput 30-50%. New margin 35-45%.
business_models.production_fit: BEST FIT -- variable products, quality-sensitive, high labor %, strong brand differentiation

business_models.name: AI-Powered Craft Food Production Platform

tier_1.key_signals: REAL LISTINGS: 77 CA food production businesses for sale. Wholesale bakery $1.7M revenue/$500K profit. Bottling facility available. Specialty charcuterie, artisanal sausage, Mexican snacks operations. USDA VAPG $250K (corrected from $200K), highly competitive. SBA 504 fee waiver for manufacturers. FDA PCHF compliance $22K year 1, $8K/yr ongoing. FSMA 204 food traceability rule NEW in 2026.
tier_1.cycle_4_updates: STRESS TESTED. Score -1 (from 80). #1 kill risk: Commodity margins too thin + input cost volatility. RESULT: Specialty/branded products (20-35% margins) are viable. Commodity products (5-10% margins) are NOT -- input cost swings (wheat, dairy, sugar) can wipe margins. CRITICAL FILTER: Must target branded/specialty producers with pricing power, not commodity. FDA PCHF compliance $22K yr1/$8K ongoing is manageable and creates moat. NEW RISK: FSMA 204 food traceability rule (2026) + PFAS/microplastics regulatory concerns add compliance burden. These are MOATS once navigated.
barriers: Commodity margin risk (MUST target specialty/branded only)
FDA/USDA certification transfer (strong moat once achieved)
FSMA 204 food traceability rule (NEW 2026 -- compliance moat)
Raw material cost volatility (wheat, dairy, sugar)
next_steps: Screen BizBuySell food production listings: FILTER for specialty/branded with 20%+ margins
Prioritize wholesale bakery or specialty producer with existing distribution + brand
Model USDA VAPG + SBA 504 capital stack for specific target
Identify cobot packaging + AI QC integration partners
Research FSMA 204 compliance requirements and timeline

tier_1.structural_shift: Insurance Claims AI -- SMB/TPA Layer (O*NET VALIDATED)

business_models.name: AI Claims Processing for TPAs and Mid-Market Insurers
AI Claims for LATAM Insurance Market

tier_1.key_signals: 78% P&C insurers adopted GenAI but only 4% SCALED. Manual error rates 7-12%. AI needs >95% accuracy. 88% customer concern about human oversight. Microsoft + Cognizant deploying enterprise solutions. Total AI claims startup funding still <$20M. O*NET: Claims Adjusters 63% automation risk, Insurance Sales 80%. BLS: 293K claims adjusters at $75,050/yr + 457K insurance sales at $59,000/yr = combined $36B automatable wage base.
tier_1.cycle_4_updates: Score unchanged. O*NET data adds quantitative layer: Claims Adjusters 63% (moderate -- significant judgment component resists), Insurance Sales 80% (high -- mostly routine). Combined $36B automatable wage base. The 63% claims adjuster rate supports the human-in-the-loop model for complex claims. NOT YET STRESS TESTED -- priority for cycle 5.
moats: First-mover on NAIC AI model law
next_steps: Focus on auto/property claims (simpler, lower stakes)
Build for >95% accuracy with human-in-the-loop for complex cases
5-state compliance first
LATAM version for cross-border expansion
STRESS TEST in cycle 5

tier_2.structural_shift: Mental Health AI -- Sub-Clinical/Productivity (NEW ENTRY, P4 DEAD REVIVAL)

business_models.name: AI Therapy Productivity Platform for Clinicians
Sub-Clinical AI Wellness (Below FDA Threshold)
AI Behavioral Health for Employers (EAP Replacement)

tier_2.key_signals: Woebot Health dead (Jul 2025, $123M raised). FDA pathway blocked for clinical AI therapy. BUT: MindSync $720M, Slingshot Health $93M, Talkiatry $130M -- market is MASSIVE and growing. Utah HB 452 (May 2025) first state to regulate AI therapy chatbots -- regulatory moat forming. 75% of US counties are mental health professional shortage areas. Massive Jevons: at $10-30/mo vs $150-300/session, 5-10x TAM expansion. Woebot's failure is P4 Dead Business Revival -- market proven, regulatory path was the failure mode. Sub-clinical and therapist productivity tools avoid FDA.
tier_2.cycle_4_updates: NEW ENTRY. Promoted from under-explored/monitoring. Woebot's $123M collapse validates the market while revealing the failure mode (FDA pathway, not demand). Three viable paths that avoid FDA: (1) therapist productivity tools, (2) sub-clinical wellness below regulatory threshold, (3) employer EAP replacement. Utah regulatory moat forming. 75% county shortage = massive Jevons expansion potential.
barriers: FDA pathway blocked for clinical claims (Woebot precedent)
State regulation forming (Utah HB 452, others following)
Trust in AI for mental health (sensitive domain)
moats: State regulatory compliance (Utah first, others following)
next_steps: Deep-dive: map which states are following Utah on AI therapy regulation
Identify therapist productivity tool gap (notes, billing, treatment plans)
Assess sub-clinical wellness market size
Monitor MindSync and Slingshot trajectories

tier_2.key_signals: Lawhive $60M Series B, $35M ARR, 7x growth, 35 US states. O*NET: Paralegals 90% automation risk ($20B automatable wage bill). Lawyers 23% (judgment-premium, resists automation). 37% SMBs already using AI for legal. Garfield AI SRA-regulated. August $375/mo for small firms.
tier_2.cycle_4_updates: Score unchanged. O*NET data confirms the split: Paralegals 90% automatable ($20B wage bill) vs Lawyers 23% (judgment resists). AI does paralegal work; lawyers provide judgment. This validates the AGG prediction-judgment unbundling thesis. Lawhive remains the dominant competitive threat at the service layer.

structural_shifts_active.shift: Capital Allocation Rotation to Physical AI

structural_shifts_active.note: CRITICAL: Intuit Accountant Suite = incumbent moving tool-to-service (Feb 2026). Bench collapse = dead revival at full-service. Three-layer framework holds but service layer competition INCREASING. Full-service remains frontier.

TWO major P4 signals: Bench ($113M, accounting) + Woebot ($123M, mental health). Combined $236M in proven-market failures. Failure modes are SOLVABLE: cost structure (AI-first) and regulatory path (sub-clinical). Markets validated, orphaned customers available.
Lawhive ($60M AI law firm) is the archetype.
Goldman $527B capex confirms installation phase still running. Deployment phase businesses = highest conviction.

NEW analytical framework. O*NET automation% x BLS wages x employment = total automatable wage bill. Ranking: Accountants $75B, Bookkeepers $64B, Insurance Sales $22B, Paralegals $20B, Claims Adjusters $14B, Medical Records $9B, Tax Preparers $4B. Total: $207B. PREMIUM side: RNs $247B, Lawyers $82B.

barrier_index_summary.note: v2 cycle 4: 4 new barriers added (Intuit Accountant Suite competition, Bench collapse precedent, raw material cost volatility, government procurement cycles). 10 resolved unknowns (O*NET automation, BLS wages, Bench failure mode, Intuit positioning, cobot ROI, FDA compliance cost, mental health landscape, real estate density, government AI, CPA licensing). 62% of barriers have moat potential.

v1_vs_v2_comparison.v2_cycle_4: 4 cycles, 5 Tier 1 (18 opportunities total), 37 business models, 14 running patterns, 10 resolved unknowns this cycle. QUANTITATIVE cycle: O*NET + BLS data replaces qualitative automation estimates. Stress tests on top 3. Mental Health AI promoted. Government AI assessed. Real Estate AI dismissed.
v1_vs_v2_comparison.key_difference: v2-4 is a QUANTITATIVE DEEPENING cycle. For the first time, Baumol Cure claims are backed by real occupational automation data (O*NET) cross-referenced with real wages and employment (BLS). $207B automatable wage bill is not an estimate -- it's calculated from government data. Stress tests use real competitive intelligence (Intuit roadmap, Bench failure data, cobot adoption rates).
